paragraphs.content: Chapter 37
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 37

paragraphs.content: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.

paragraphs.content: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.

paragraphs.content: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.

paragraphs.content: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.
paragraphs.contentHtml: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

paragraphs.content: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.

paragraphs.content: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.

paragraphs.content: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

paragraphs.content: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.

paragraphs.content: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.

paragraphs.content: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

paragraphs.content: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

paragraphs.content: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.

paragraphs.content: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.

paragraphs.content: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

paragraphs.content: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?

paragraphs.content: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?

paragraphs.content: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?

paragraphs.content: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?

paragraphs.content: Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

paragraphs.content: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.

paragraphs.content: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

paragraphs.content: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.

paragraphs.content: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.

paragraphs.content: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
